article:
:"Silverbeet" redirects here. For the album by The Bats, see [[Silverbeet
:(album)]].

{{taxobox |image = Chard in the Victory Garden.jpg |image_caption = Red chard
growing at Slow Food Nation |regnum = Plantae |unranked_divisio = Angiosperms
|unranked_classis = Eudicots |unranked_ordo = Core eudicots |ordo =
Caryophyllales |familia = Amaranthaceae |subfamilia = Betoideae |genus = [[Beta
(plant)|Beta]] |species = [[Beta vulgaris|B. vulgaris]] |subspecies =
'B. vulgarissubsp.cicla' |subspecies_authority = (L.) W.D.J.Koch  This plant, treated as a subspecies of Beta vulgaris, was first
published in Synopsis der Deutschen und Schweizer Flora 2: 720. 1846. Its
basionym is B. vulgaris var. cicla L.  The
basionym of B. vulgaris subsp. cicla (B. vulgaris var. cicla L.) was
originally described and published in [[Species Plantarum]] 1: 222. 1753. 
|synonyms = *Beta vulgaris var. cicla L. (basionym) |synonyms_ref
=  }}

'Chard' (Beta vulgaris subsp. cicla), is a leafy green
vegetable often used in Mediterranean cooking. While the leaves are always
green, chard stalks vary in color.  [http://topics.n-
ytimes.com/top/news/health/series/recipes_for_health/chard/index.html] 17
November 2011, The New York Times  Chard has been bred to have highly
nutritious leaves at the expense of the root (which is not as nutritious as the
leaves).  [http://www.wisegeek.com/what-is-chard.htm] 17
November 2011, Wise Geek  Chard is, in fact, considered to be one of the
healthiest vegetables available and a valuable addition to a healthy diet (like
other green leafy vegetables). 
[http://whfoods.org/genpage.php?tname=foodspice&dbid=16] World's Healthiest
Foods, George Mateljan Foundation, 17 November 2011 World's Healthiest Foods
 Chard has been around for centuries, but because of its similarity to
beets it is difficult to determine the exact evolution of the different
varieties of chard. 
[http://www.cliffordawright.com/caw/food/entries/display.php/topic_id/6/id/36/]
17 November 2011 Clifford A. Wright
